Metadata.Title: How to Protect Communication Between Desktop And Server
Metadata.DirectLink: How to Protect Communication Between Desktop And Server
Metadata.Priority: J.D. Meier, Alex Mackman, Blaine Wastell, Prashant Bansode, Chaitanya Bijwe

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • .NET 2.0

Description

Use SSL to encrypt the communication channel between specific client applications and a server. For example, you could use SSL to encrypt the channel between a desktop application and a remote computer running SQL Server.


Adapted from Microsoft patterns & practices guidance.
